resources.string: I\'m not very confident but here are my predictions
Hmm....not really sure if its a dog, but if I had to guess here are my guesses

The model outputs values, each one of which is called "confidence" value. This denotes the probability of the dog in the image belonging to a class (i.e breed). In other words, it simply denotes how confident the model is that the given image is of a dog of some particular breed.

 So, what this means is, that if, for example, the results for a dog are as follows

 Beagle - 98%
 Border Collie - 0.88%
 Saint Bernard - 0.1% etc

then this does NOT mean that the model thinks the dog is a mix of said breeds. The results only show the top 5 guesses and how confident the model is with each guess.
For privacy policy and terms and conditions click here

For getting the best results, make sure you have sufficient lighting, and the dog is in the centre of the frame and is in focus and in foreground. Make sure you have only one dog in the picture. Also, ensure that the dog is not wearing any clothing, like those fancy hats or sweaters, as they may affect results. Also do note that the face of the dog is visible to get the best possible result.

 If the dog is of mixed breed, then the accuracy of the results may suffer because it is almost impossible to determine the mix of breeds of a dog, just by looking at a photo without proper DNA Test. 

Still not getting accurate results?
to check the list of supported breeds
Do you know the breed of the dog?
If the breed name doesn\'t appear in the suggestions, then it is currently not supported and will be in the future :)
